text: 124.4. Decode Directories (Number of Entries) The following is the hexdump of a directory that uses the following structure for its dirents. struct dirent { ino_t d_ino; // 32 bits __uintl6_t d_reclen; __uint8_t d_type; __uint8_t d_namlen; char d_name[255+1]; I #define DT_DIR 4 #define DT_REG 8 #define DT_LNK 10 How many valid entries are in this directory? 0000000 00 00 10 00 Oc 00 04 01 2e 00 00 00 01 00 10 00 0000010 Oc 00 04 02 2e 2e 00 00 02 00 10 00 10 00 04 04 0000020 50 69 6b 65 00 00 00 00 64 00 00 00 10 00 0a 05 0000030 5a 65 62 72 61 00 00 00 03 00 10 00 10 00 04 05 0000040 56 69 70 65 72 00 00 00 00 00 00 00 10 00 08 04 0000050 46 72 6T 67 00 00 00 00 65 00 00 00 10 00 08 05 0000060 43 72 61 6e 65 00 00 00 04 00 10 00 20 00 04 16 0000070 43 6f 6d 6d 6f 6e 20 68 6f 75 73 65 68 6f 6Â¢C 64 0000080 20 70 65 73 74 73 00 00 66 00 00 00 18 00 0a Oc 0000090 42 65 61 6b 65 64 20 77 68 61 6C 65 00 6 6C 64 0000020 05 00 10 00 Oc 00 04 03 43 6f 77 00 67 00 00 00 00000b0 10 00 08 04 46 72 6f 67 00 64 20 77 00000bc integer (-] Save & Grade Single attempt Ad(ditional attempts available with new variants @
